documents.text:
--- Visit 1 | Date: 2025-06-02 ---

Patient SB-P002 presents for scheduled cycle 1 visit.

Vitals: BP 146/74 mmHg, HR 85 bpm, Weight 82.1 kg.

Patient reports severe nausea since last visit, onset approximately day 21. Resolved by day 45. No dose modification required.

Routine labs obtained:
  - PSA: 11.83 ng/mL [ref 0.0-4.0] (HIGH)
  - ALT: 32.31 U/L [ref 7.0-56.0]
  - AST: 20.29 U/L [ref 10.0-40.0]
  - Hemoglobin: 15.12 g/dL [ref 12.0-17.5]
  - WBC: 5.26 10^3/uL [ref 4.5-11.0]
  - Creatinine: 0.84 mg/dL [ref 0.7-1.3]

Assessment: Tolerating therapy. Plan to continue protocol. Next visit in 3 weeks.

--- Visit 2 | Date: 2025-06-23 ---

SB-P002 — Cycle 2, Day 1 visit.

On exam, BP is 151/97, pulse 86, wt 64.3 kg. Patient appears comfortable, no distress noted.

Liver enzymes elevated — classified as Grade 4 hepatotoxicity. Detected on day 22 labs. Currently ongoing. Treatment was held pending resolution. Dose interruption documented.

Blood work results:
  - PSA: 10.21 ng/mL [ref 0.0-4.0] (HIGH)
  - ALT: 34.16 U/L [ref 7.0-56.0]
  - AST: 21.6 U/L [ref 10.0-40.0]
  - Hemoglobin: 14.8 g/dL [ref 12.0-17.5]
  - WBC: 5.47 10^3/uL [ref 4.5-11.0]
  - Creatinine: 0.89 mg/dL [ref 0.7-1.3]

Imaging reveals meaningful tumor shrinkage consistent with partial response (PR). Target lesion regression of ~49.2%.

PSA now 6.31 ng/mL — decrease 49.2% from initial value.

Assessment: Tolerating therapy. Plan to continue protocol. Next visit in 3 weeks.

--- Visit 3 | Date: 2025-07-14 ---

Visit 3 clinical encounter for SB-P002.

On exam, BP is 149/89, pulse 56, wt 99.9 kg. Patient appears well-nourished and in no acute distress.

No new adverse events reported since last visit.

Labs drawn today:
  - PSA: 9.66 ng/mL [ref 0.0-4.0] (HIGH)
  - ALT: 33.57 U/L [ref 7.0-56.0]
  - AST: 22.69 U/L [ref 10.0-40.0]
  - Hemoglobin: 14.92 g/dL [ref 12.0-17.5]
  - WBC: 5.03 10^3/uL [ref 4.5-11.0]
  - Creatinine: 0.81 mg/dL [ref 0.7-1.3]

Plan: Continue therapy per protocol with supportive medications. Return for cycle 4 in 3 weeks.

--- Visit 4 | Date: 2025-08-04 ---

Follow-up visit #4 for patient SB-P002.

Vitals: BP 126/81 mmHg, HR 72 bpm, Weight 98.4 kg.

No new adverse events reported since last visit.

Routine labs obtained:
  - PSA: 10.19 ng/mL [ref 0.0-4.0] (HIGH)
  - ALT: 35.21 U/L [ref 7.0-56.0]
  - AST: 22.58 U/L [ref 10.0-40.0]
  - Hemoglobin: 14.45 g/dL [ref 12.0-17.5]
  - WBC: 4.53 10^3/uL [ref 4.5-11.0]
  - Creatinine: 0.94 mg/dL [ref 0.7-1.3]

CT restaging shows partial response. Target lesions reduced significantly (40.7% decrease from baseline). No new lesions identified. RECIST: PR.

PSA now 7.36 ng/mL — decrease 40.7% from initial value.

Plan: Supportive care as needed. Return for cycle 5 in 3 weeks.

--- Visit 5 | Date: 2025-08-25 ---

Follow-up visit #5 for patient SB-P002.

Vitals: BP 118/89 mmHg, HR 88 bpm, Weight 74.0 kg.

Blood work results:
  - PSA: 8.58 ng/mL [ref 0.0-4.0] (HIGH)
  - ALT: 34.15 U/L [ref 7.0-56.0]
  - AST: 24.74 U/L [ref 10.0-40.0]
  - Hemoglobin: 14.3 g/dL [ref 12.0-17.5]
  - WBC: 4.13 10^3/uL [ref 4.5-11.0] (LOW)
  - Creatinine: 0.89 mg/dL [ref 0.7-1.3]

Assessment: Tolerating therapy. Plan to continue protocol. Next visit in 3 weeks.

--- Visit 6 | Date: 2025-09-15 ---

Scheduled visit 6 was not completed. patient reported feeling too unwell to travel to site.

--- Visit 7 | Date: 2025-10-06 ---

Routine protocol visit 7. Patient ID: SB-P002.

On exam, BP is 143/73, pulse 70, wt 88.7 kg. Patient appears mildly fatigued but alert and oriented.

Blood work results:
  - PSA: 7.83 ng/mL [ref 0.0-4.0] (HIGH)
  - ALT: 36.91 U/L [ref 7.0-56.0]
  - AST: 25.54 U/L [ref 10.0-40.0]
  - Hemoglobin: 13.98 g/dL [ref 12.0-17.5]
  - WBC: 3.82 10^3/uL [ref 4.5-11.0] (LOW)
  - Creatinine: 0.96 mg/dL [ref 0.7-1.3]

Plan: Continue current dose. Return for cycle 8 in 3 weeks.

--- Visit 8 | Date: 2025-10-27 ---

Patient did not present for scheduled visit 8. Attempted phone contact — unable to reach patient.
